p: Amongst target species and under today’s climate, upland species have the smallest predicted ranges, whereas western species have the largest predicted ranges ( Table 4, Figs 1 and 2). Overall, ensemble model accuracy remained very high, ranging from 97.2–100% ( Table 4). Table 5 shows the variables most important in the modelling of each species’ distribution for each model type: for all upland species’ the most important contributing variable in the models is mean temperature of the warmest quarter.
